issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

fields.summary: Incorrect computation of needed blocks in getTurnOffTip()

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: GetTurnOffTip overstates the number of blocks necessary to come out of safe mode by 1 due to an arbitrary '+1' in the code.
fields.summary: getTurnOffTip computes needed block incorrectly for threshold < 1 in b2.7

comments.body: Attaching a patch that fixes the issue by making blockThreshold equal to the ceiling of blockTotal*threshold

This message was automatically generated.

Not a critical fix for 2.7, so closing as won't fix.

As for trunk, after speaking offline with [~daryn] and [~kihwal], it looks like truncating (i.e. rounding down) is the easier approach here, so we'll just leave this as is and not change anything. The off by 1 error is already fixed there.
